instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS is floating
threads.message:
Hello,everybody!

I have another Macbook Pro 13 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> , Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, no liquid damaged

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> is floating constantly like I have shortage . 

I've removed the F5200 and have good voltage on <CAPACITOR>C5250</CAPACITOR> 

I've tried to inject some volts on this rail , but no current consumption...

In diod mode I have 600 ohm (if red on the ground) and nothing in another way

What's it be?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS is floating
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> pulsing too?
Also check <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> LDOs.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS is floating
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> is stable, 3.8 volts
But <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> is floating constantly from 7v to 12,3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS is floating
threads.message: Compare diode mode readings on all power rails with good board, or OpenBoardData reference table.
